security_audit.summary: The scanned files are markdown and JSON documentation only. No executable code, network calls, or filesystem access are present. Risk is minimal for users.

content.user_title: Implement NFT standards with ERC-721 and ERC-1155
content.value_statement: NFT builders need clear guidance on standards, metadata, and minting. This skill gives practical patterns for ERC-721, ERC-1155, and marketplace readiness.
actual_capabilities: Explain ERC-721 and ERC-1155 standard differences
Provide Solidity examples for minting and supply limits
Describe off-chain and on-chain metadata schemas
Show patterns for soulbound, dynamic, and ERC721A NFTs
limitations: Does not deploy contracts or run blockchain transactions
Does not upload assets to IPFS or manage pinning
Does not perform security audits of custom contracts
Does not integrate with marketplace APIs

use_cases.title: Select a token standard
use_cases.description: Compare ERC-721 and ERC-1155 for a new collection and choose the right model.

use_cases.title: Design metadata schema
use_cases.description: Define fields that display correctly across major NFT marketplaces and wallets.

use_cases.title: Plan multi-token items
use_cases.description: Set ERC-1155 item IDs, supplies, and mint rules for game assets.

prompt_templates.title: Choose ERC standard
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend ERC-721 or ERC-1155 for a 5,000 item art drop and explain tradeoffs.

prompt_templates.title: Metadata checklist
prompt_templates.prompt: List required and optional metadata fields for NFT JSON and note best practices for images and attributes.

prompt_templates.title: Royalties policy
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain how to implement EIP-2981 royalties and suggest a safe fee cap.

prompt_templates.title: Dynamic NFT design
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a dynamic NFT approach that updates metadata based on on-chain state changes.

output_examples.input: Help me design an ERC-1155 game item set with three item types and supply limits.
output: Use fixed token IDs per item type to enable batch minting.
Set max supply per ID and enforce it in mint functions.
Host metadata at ipfs://.../{id}.json with clear attributes for rarity and power.

best_practices: Use OpenZeppelin base contracts for standards compliance
Keep metadata consistent and pinned on IPFS
Document mint limits and royalty settings
anti_patterns: Mixing ERC-721 and ERC-1155 without a clear need
Changing metadata without a disclosure policy
Storing large assets fully on-chain without cost justification

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides guidance and examples that work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It does not deploy contracts, run transactions, or audit your code.

faq.question: Does it integrate with marketplace APIs?
faq.answer: No. It explains standards and metadata, but it does not call marketplace services.

faq.question: Does it access my files or keys?
faq.answer: No. It is static guidance and does not access local files or credentials.

faq.question: How do I troubleshoot missing metadata display?
faq.answer: Verify tokenURI format, JSON fields, and IPFS pinning status.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full audit tool?
faq.answer: It offers design guidance only, not automated testing or formal security review.
